Device¶

The Device class handles persistent settings saved in json files in labAPI/settings. Settings are loaded into the Device.params dict and are handled differently based on their “type”: “state” objects are loaded into a state vector to be made accessible by the Optimizer class, while “settings” objects (e.g. velocity of the a translation stage) are not.

class device.Device(name, base_path=None, lowlevel=True, parent=None)¶

Bases: object

__init__(name, base_path=None, lowlevel=True, parent=None)¶

Instantiate a Device with a given name. Setting base_path allows nonstandard settings file locations. Settings files will only exist if lowlevel=True. If parent is not None, the Device is added as a child to the parent Hub.

_actuate(state)¶

Placeholder to be overwritten for a specific device

_delete(setpoint)¶

Read in setpoints from file, delete target setpoint, and write

_get_index_by_param(param)¶

Returns a state index given a parameter

_get_param_by_index(index)¶

Returns a params dict entry given a state index

_load(setpoint)¶

Read in setpoints from file

_params_to_state()¶

Prepare the normalized state vector of the Device by parsing all state variables

_save(setpoint=None)¶

Read in setpoints from file, append or update current setpoint, and write

_state_to_params()¶

Update the params file with the current values of the state vector

_update_parent()¶

Push current params upstream to parent

actuate(state)¶

Ensures that the target state is within bounds, then calls the device-specific _actuate() method to update the physical state. Finally, updates the internal state and params
